data.title: #Mountain
data.statement: Your goal is to create an abstract rectangle image of a mountain with width [[N]] by using {{#}} symbols as your building blocks for the mountain itself and {{.}} symbols for the air above the mountain.
data.constraints:
First line tells you how many [[Si]] follow, where 3  <= [[N]] <= 15
Each [[Si]] represents the stack height at position i, where 1 <= [[Si]] <= 7
Positions [[i]] are 0-based, so we have 0 <= i < [[N]]
data.stubGenerator:
read width:int
loop width read height:int
write #mountain
data.inputDescription:
You get a sequence of [[N]] Integers [[Si]].
Each Integer [[Si]] represents the number of {{#}} symbols that have to be stacked on top of each other at their respective positions [[i]] (from left to right).
The number of {{.}} symbols that represent the air above the mountain is <<not>> given and has to be inferred for each position [[i]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your goal is to create an abstract rectangle image of a mountain with width N by using # symbols as your building blocks for the mountain itself and . symbols for the air above the mountain.
Input
You get a sequence of N Integers Si.
Each Integer Si represents the number of # symbols that have to be stacked on top of each other at their respective positions i (from left to right).
The number of . symbols that represent the air above the mountain is not given and has to be inferred for each position i.
Output
A correct #Mountain
Constraints
First line tells you how many Si follow, where 3 <= N <= 15
Each Si represents the stack height at position i, where 1 <= Si <= 7
Positions i are 0-based, so we have 0 <= i < N
Example
Input
3
1
4
2
Output
.#.
.#.
.##
###
